dataModel.title: Prototype Veg Plots Database Component Description: stand
dataModel.author: J. Harris

entity.entitySummary: This table stores information about the stand from which a plot was sampled.
entity.entityDescription: A stand is a spatially continuous distribution of vegetation. The goal of many plot collections is to sample vegetation thought to reflect a stand and thus plots are usually recorded within a stand. Information in this table is intended to describe the stand from which plots are taken. A general problem with this table is the potential for a single stand to be represented twice - each by a unique identifier.

attribute.attDefinition: This is an internal database identifier assigned to each uniquely used stand.
This is the estimated size of a stand in meters-squared.

attribute.attNotes: Stands are not usually named, so a description is best way to identify a unique stand.
attribute.attDefinition: This is the estimated size of a stand in meters-squared.
